Maze

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • Maze.Character

  • public class Character
extends java.lang.Object
    Character class which contains information on how a character object (player) should behave; handles movement upon input, collisions and redraw functions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private GraphicsMaze colMaze
      Graphics Maze object used to obtain a clone of the current maze drawn in order for correct collision detection.
      private int height
      Character object's height.
      private static int movementSpeed
      Character object's (Rectangle) movement speed in pixels.
      private MoveHandler mover
      Move handler object which character object depends on to correctly handle movements, all input handlers must meet this specification.
      private java.awt.image.BufferedImage playerImg
      Buffered image container for the character's sprite.
      private int width
      Character object's width.
      private int xPos
      x coordinate of character object's current position in the maze.
      private int yPos
      y coordinate of character object's current position in the maze.

    • Constructor Summary

      Initializes the initial x and y position of the character object, the speed and the dimensions (size of player).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character(int xPos,
         int yPos,
         GraphicsMaze g)
        Initializes the initial x and y position of the character object, the speed and the dimensions (size of player). Obtains the most recent drawn copy of the maze for collision detection and loads the sprite representing the character object.
        Parameters:
        xPos - Initial x position.
        yPos - Initial y position.
        g - Graphics rendering object used to draw to the window (JFrame/JPanel).

    • Method Detail

      • setMover

        public void setMover(MoveHandler m)
        Sets up the move handler to be used with the input handler m.
        Parameters:
        m - An input handler which meets the specifications of the move handler object.

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()

        Rectangle Rectangle object with character object's current position and size.

      • collide

        public boolean collide(java.lang.String direc)
        Collision detection/avoidance, projects a copy of the character object to a new position corresponding to the direction "direc" and then checks if a collision will occur at that point before moving the player. Possible collisions that can occur are wall collisions, time point collisions and end point collisions. The character can't pass walls (wall collision) and certain events are triggered when the character object collides with an end point or time point. Returns true if collision occurs otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:
        direc - String representing the anticipated direction.

      • move

        public void move()
        Performs a move operation in the corresponding direction if there are no possible collisions.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Redraws the character object based on the current position and size.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics rendering object used to draw to the window (JFrame/JPanel).
